Class DatabaseAccess

java.lang.Object
  eu.clementime.rds.DatabaseAccess

public class DatabaseAccess
extends java.lang.Object

All queries are stored in DatabaseAccess class.

Method Detail

selectBackground

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectBackground(int screenId)
Finds background & foreground images, and boundaries (x min & max out of which doll can't go).

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> x min,
> x max,
> background image name,
> foreground image name

selectScreenItems

public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> selectScreenItems(int screenId)
Returns a list of items to be displayed on screen.

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
Returns:
a linked list of hash map of strings with:
> item id,
> image,
> height of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> width of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> x position of item on screen,
> y position of item on screen,
> can the doll try to take this item,
> can the doll try to look at this item,
> is this item takeable,
> is this item on foreground or not

selectAnimations

public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> selectAnimations(int screenId)
Returns a list of animations to be displayed on screen.

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
Returns:
a linked list of hash map of strings with:
> animation id,
> image,
> number of rows in this image (to launch AndEngine animation),
> number of columns in this image (to launch AndEngine animation),
> height of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> width of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> x position of animation on screen,
> y position of animation on screen,
> the frame where animation should stop at end,
> x position where animation should go if it is a moving animation OR if the animation is run at different places,
> y position where animation should go if it is a moving animation OR if the animation is run at different places,
> is animation chased by camera or not

selectExits

public java.util.ArrayList<Exit> selectExits(int screenId,
                                             org.anddev.andengine.opengl.texture.region.TiledTextureRegion TRLeft,
                                             org.anddev.andengine.opengl.texture.region.TiledTextureRegion TRRight,
                                             int MARGIN)
Returns a list of exits to be displayed on screen.

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
TRLeft - TiledTextureRegion, to create animated sprite of exit
TRRight - TiledTextureRegion, to create animated sprite of exit
MARGIN - y margin, to position animated sprite of exit
Returns:
a array list of exit objects containing following information:
> exit id,
> exit direction (left or right),
> x position of exit on screen,
> y position of exit on screen,
> is exit displayed,
> is there a trigger to launch before leaving the screen by this exit,
> is there a trigger to launch after leaving the screen by this exit (in new screen),
> x position where doll should start in the next screen after leaving by this exit,
> y position where doll should start in the next screen after leaving by this exit,
> screen id of next screen (after exit)

selectAreas

public java.util.ArrayList<Area> selectAreas(int screenId,
                                             int MARGIN)
Returns a list of areas to be stored in Background object.

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
MARGIN - y margin, to position area
Returns:
a array list of areas containing following information:
> area id,
> x position of area on screen,
> y position of area on screen,
> width of this area,
> height of this area

selectDisplayedAnims

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> selectDisplayedAnims(int screenId)
Returns a list of animation id of animations displayed on screen.

Parameters:
screenId - id of concerned screen
Returns:
a array list of animation id

selectStaticAnimFeatures

public int[] selectStaticAnimFeatures(int animId)
Returns features of a static animation (= an animation that doesn't move and loop infinitely, as characters or landscape animation).

Parameters:
animId - database id of animation
Returns:
an integer array with 3 entries:
> first frame,
> last frame,
> frame duration (in ms)

selectAnimStates

public int[] selectAnimStates(int animId)
Returns states of a static animation (= an animation that doesn't move and loop infinitely, as characters or landscape animation).

Parameters:
animId - database id of animation
Returns:
an integer array with 3 entries:
> can the doll try to take this animation (=take state),
> can the doll look at this animation (=look state),
> can the doll talk to this animation (=talk state)

selectItemStates

public int[] selectItemStates(int itemId)
Returns states of a screen item.

Parameters:
itemId - database id of item
Returns:
an integer array with 3 entries:
> can the doll try to take this item (=take state),
> can the doll look at this item (=look state),
> can the doll talk to this item (=talk state)

selectAreaStates

public int[] selectAreaStates(int areaId)
Returns states of a screen area.

Parameters:
areaId - database id of area
Returns:
an integer array with 3 entries:
> can the doll try to take this area (=take state), always 0/impossible,
> can the doll look at this area (=look state),
> can the doll talk to this area (=talk state)

selectItem

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectItem(int itemId)
Returns information about an item when one is added by combination of other items.

Parameters:
itemId - id of concerned item
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> item id,
> image,
> height of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> width of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> is this item displayed,
> x position of item on screen,
> y position of item on screen,
> can the doll try to take this item,
> can the doll try to look at this item,
> is this item takeable,
> is this item on foreground or not

selectInventoryItems

public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> selectInventoryItems()
Returns list of items to be displayed in inventory.

Returns:
a linked list of hash map of strings with:
> item id,
> image

updateInventoryField

public void updateInventoryField(java.lang.String where,
                                 int value)
Updates item table to set an item in inventory when taken by the doll or to remove it from inventory when used in a combination.

Parameters:
where - where clause
value - 1=on screen; 2=in inventory; 0=not displayed anywhere

selectInventoryItem

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectInventoryItem(int itemId)
Returns information about a new item added in inventory.

Parameters:
itemId - database id item
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> item id,
> image,
> height of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas),
> width of image (to fill BitmapTextureAtlas)

selectCombination

public int[] selectCombination(int idItem1,
                               int idItem2,
                               int type)
Returns information about a combination.

Parameters:
idItem1 - database id of first item combined
idItem2 - database id of second item combined
type - on screen or in inventory
Returns:
an integer tab with 3 entries:
> id combination if combination ok, 0 if no combination allowed,
> id of resulting item if combination allowed,
> on screen creation: 0=combination create a new item in inventory, 1=new item has to be created on screen

selectTriggers

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> selectTriggers(int id,
                                                             java.lang.String tableName)
Finds id of triggers to launch.

Parameters:
id - id of the concerned object (depending on the table, can be a combination id, another trigger id...)
tableName - name of the concerned table (combination, trigger...)
Returns:
one or more trigger id in an ArrayList

selectTrigger

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectTrigger(int triggerId)
Finds information about a trigger.

Parameters:
triggerId - id of the trigger to launch
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> trigger id,
> object to trigger id,
> type of triggering,
> next trigger id,
> simultaneous trigger id

selectDollTrigger

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectDollTrigger(int toTriggerId)
Finds information about an automatic move of the doll (not coming from player action, but from a trigger).

Parameters:
toTriggerId - id of the move to trigger
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> x position the doll should reach,
> if doll is hidden (1=hidden/0=is not),
> y velocity of the doll during this move,

selectModifier

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> selectModifier(int modifierId)
Finds information about a modifier; a modifier automatically changes database and is launched by a trigger.

Parameters:
modifierId - id of the modifier to launch
Returns:
a hash map of strings with:
> new state that should be written in database,
> type of modification (to select right table to modify),
> id of the object that should be modified (a screen starting trigger, a look state, a take state, displaying of an item, etc...)
See Also:
World.activateModifier(int)

selectTakeable

public boolean selectTakeable(int itemId)
Finds if an item is takeable or not.

Parameters:
itemId - database id of item
Returns:
boolean

selectDisplayed

public int selectDisplayed(int itemId)
Finds if an item is displayed on screen or not.

Parameters:
itemId - database id of item
Returns:
0=not displayed/1=displayed

updateWithModifier

public void updateWithModifier(java.lang.String tableName,
                               java.lang.String fieldName,
                               int newState,
                               java.lang.String where)
Updates a field with information coming from a modifier.

Parameters:
tableName - table name for query
fieldName - field to be updated in this table
newState - new value of field
where - where clause
See Also:
World.activateModifier(int)

selectLanguage

public java.lang.String selectLanguage(Context context)
Search if phone language is available (English is used if not).

Parameters:
context - Android context, to retrieve files
Returns:
language isocode

selectText

public java.lang.String selectText(java.lang.String reference,
                                   java.lang.String language)
Selects text from general text table, for menus, settings...

Parameters:
reference - reference of searched text in text table
language - isocode language
Returns:
text
See Also:
selectLanguage(Context)

selectPlayingHand

public int selectPlayingHand()
Selects player hand (left or right handed player) in settings.

Parameters:
reference - 0=left; 1=right

selectYVelocity

public float selectYVelocity(int screenId)
Selects y velocity of the doll in this screen (0=flat ground; <0=go up from left to right; >0=go down from left to right).

Parameters:
screenId - id of the current screen

selectDollScreen

public int selectDollScreen()
Finds which screen the doll is in.

Returns:
id of the screen

selectDollPosition

public int[] selectDollPosition()
Finds where the doll is at launching time (x and y).

Returns:
tab with 2 entries:
> [0] x position of doll,
> [1] y position

selectFirstScreenFeatures

public int[] selectFirstScreenFeatures()
Returns information about a screen from exit table, when doll leaves a screen for another (also used for first screen, with exit 0).

Returns:
tab with 4 entries:
> [0] screen id,
> [1] x position of doll in this new screen,
> [2] y position,
> [3] trigger to launch when starting screen

selectAnimFeatures

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> selectAnimFeatures(int animId)
Returns information about an animation.

Parameters:
animId - database animation id
Returns:
tab with 7 entries:
> [0] number of the first frame,
> [1] number of the last frame,
> [2] duration of each frame (in ms),
> [3] number of loop of the animation,
> [4] x velocity of this animation (=animation is playing AND moving on screen),
> [5] y velocity of this animation (=animation is playing AND moving on screen),
> [6] is the doll hidden or not (1=hidden/0=is not)

updateWhenSaving

public void updateWhenSaving(int screenId,
                             float x,
                             float y)
Updates doll position when leaving game.

Parameters:
screenId - id of the current screen
x - x position of doll in this screen
y - y position of doll in this screen

selectTalks

public void selectTalks(int screenId)
